sentence.text: Herein we present a case series of six individuals (five males, one female) with intellectual disability and seizures found to have alterations in modulation of chemical synaptic transmission.

We report these cases to demonstrate the exhaustive work-up prior to finding the changes in modulation of chemical synaptic transmission gene, recommend that this gene be considered earlier in the diagnostic evaluation of individuals with global developmental delay, microcephaly, and severe, intractable epilepsy, and support the use of intellectual disability panels including modulation of chemical synaptic transmission in the first-line evaluation of these patients
